Wondering why fall leaves are orange, red, and yellow?

As the days get shorter and temps drop, chlorophyll breaks down, turning leaves from bright green to those fall colors.

October is the peak season for seeing colorful trees in Arizona forests, so go see them while you can! https://t.co/QJrZIdH1AR

Without the continued protection of Arizona waters, we risk 6,381 miles of streams, critical species like the Apache Trout, and recreational water-use by anglers and outdoor enthusiasts ‚Äî activities that provide $13.5 billion to the state‚Äôs economy and support 114,000 jobs.

Today is the 50th Anniversary of the #CleanWaterAct, a law that prevents 700 billion pounds of pollutants from entering our waters annually. A current case, "Sackett v. EPA", is seeking to withdraw the Act's protections for roughly half the nation‚Äôs streams and wetlands. https://t.co/2VXviXRPxn
